text: Marc David de Hond (21 September 1977 â€“ 3 June 2020) was a Dutch television presenter, businessman, writer, theatre performer and basketball player. He played for the Dutch wheelchair basketball team during the Paralympic Games. He was also a discjockey for radio 3FM and Caz!.Broers ben je, vrienden word je Trouw, 21 April 2012 He presented on television programs such as Expedition Unlimited for LLiNK, De Rekenkamer for KRO at Nederland 3 and was the regular commentator for poker competitions at RTL 7. In 2002, de Hond became paralyzed because of a spinal cord caused by spinal cancer. In 2018, he was diagnosed with bladder cancer. de Hond died from the diseases on 3 June 2020 in Amsterdam, aged 42.Theatermaker en rolstoelsporter Marc de Hond (42) overleden Marc de Hond was born in Amsterdam. He is of Jewish origin and son of television personality Maurice de Hond. ==References== Category:1977 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in the Netherlands Category:Deaths from bladder cancer Category:Deaths from spinal cancer Category:Dutch DJs Category:Dutch businesspeople Category:Dutch Jews Category:Dutch radio personalities Category:Dutch stage actors Category:Dutch television presenters Category:Dutch wheelchair basketball players Category:Jewish actors Category:Jewish businesspeople Category:Jewish sportspeople Category:Jewish writers Category:Dutch Paralympic competitors Category:Sportspeople from Amsterdam Category:Writers from Amsterdam
title: Marc de Hond
